content:
• Tuesday, March 12, 2013
  • IPAR

    More on Inter Parfums (NASDAQ:IPAR): Q4 beats on revenue, despite a 7.7% decline in net sales....

    More on Inter Parfums (NASDAQ:IPAR): Q4 beats on revenue, despite a 7.7% decline in net sales. European-based sales were down 10.1%, which was offset largely by a 25% gain in revenue fro its U.S. segment. Operating margin was 7.4% of net sales, compared to 4.8% in the prior year. The company also reaffirmed FY13 guidance. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • KTOS

    More on Kratos Defense & Security (NASDAQ:KTOS): Q4 beat the Street, but net losses widened...

    More on Kratos Defense & Security (NASDAQ:KTOS): Q4 beat the Street, but net losses widened sharply as the defense supplier recorded a heavy write-down on goodwill and intangibles related to U.S. defense budget uncertainty and defense spending weakness. Gross margin narrowed to 25.8% from 27.8%. Shares -16.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • DOLE

    More on Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q4 misses on revenue with a 7.7% Y/Y decline in total sales. Net...

    More on Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q4 misses on revenue with a 7.7% Y/Y decline in total sales. Net losses rose as the fruit-and-vegetable producer recorded weaker fresh-fruit sales due to a divestiture and was hurt by costs related to the deal. Sales of fresh vegetables, the smaller of its two units, rose 7.3%Y/Y, while fresh fruit sales - excluding businesses the company is shedding - fell 12% on lower pricing for bananas in North America as well as higher fruit costs in Europe. Shares -5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • XNPT

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: XNPT +11%. DTSI +8%. ARQL +8%. SGMS +7%. EVER-OLD +7%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: XNPT +11%. DTSI +8%. ARQL +8%. SGMS +7%. EVER-OLD +7%.
    After-hours top losers: SPPI -35%. VELT -26%. KTOS -16%. MUX -8%. TEU -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • VELTF

    Following a halt, Velti (VELT) -25.1% AH in response to its Q4 miss. Q1 guidance is for revenue...

    Following a halt, Velti (VELT) -25.1% AH in response to its Q4 miss. Q1 guidance is for revenue of $40M-$44M, well below a $62.7M consensus. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $255M-$280M, below a $339.5M consensus. 2013 free cash flow is pegged at $5M-$15M. Velti's decision to divest assets in areas with huge collection times is once more a culprit. The company is targeting 25%-35% annual growth from 2014-2016, but the Street is likely to be skeptical. Sales/marketing expenses +54% Y/Y in Q4, and R&D +69%, both well above rev. growth of 12%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • XOMA

    XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA): Q4 EPS of $0.03. Revenue of $7.39M misses by $0.48M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)

    XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA): Q4 EPS of $0.03. Revenue of $7.39M misses by $0.48M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • TEU

    Box Ships (NYSE:TEU) launches a capital raise, offering $25M worth of shares. At the current AH...

    Box Ships (NYSE:TEU) launches a capital raise, offering $25M worth of shares. At the current AH price of $5.45 (-4.9% from the close), it would add about 4.6M shares to the 16.33M share float. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • KW

    Kennedy Wilson (NYSE:KW): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $22.9M beats by $8.2M....

    Kennedy Wilson (NYSE:KW): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $22.9M beats by $8.2M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • NOVT

    GSI Group (GSIG): FQ3 EPS of $0.44. Revenue of $66.4M beats by $0.8M. Shares +7.6% AH. (PR)

    GSI Group (GSIG): FQ3 EPS of $0.44. Revenue of $66.4M beats by $0.8M. Shares +7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • PTE

    Majesco (COOL): FQ1 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $23.5M misses by $5.2M. Shares...

    Majesco (COOL): FQ1 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $23.5M misses by $5.2M. Shares -16.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • FOLD

    Amicus Theraputics (NASDAQ:FOLD): Q4 EPS of -$0.20 beats by $0.17. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)

    Amicus Theraputics (NASDAQ:FOLD): Q4 EPS of -$0.20 beats by $0.17. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)

  • EROC

    Eagle Rock Energy Partners (NASDAQ:EROC) -1.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 8M...

    Eagle Rock Energy Partners (NASDAQ:EROC) -1.4% AH after announcing a public offering of 8M common units. EROC says proceeds will be used to pay down debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • CIS

    Microcap Camelot Information Systems (CIS +11.3%) soared to $1.69 after announcing chairman/CEO...

    Microcap Camelot Information Systems (CIS +11.3%) soared to $1.69 after announcing chairman/CEO Simon Yiming Ma and other execs have made a $1.85/share going-private offer. The Chinese software outsourcing firm trades at a small fraction of its late 2010/early 2011 highs. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • EVOL

    Evolving Systems (NASDAQ:EVOL): Q4 EPS of $0.12 in-line. Revenue of $6.9M beats by $0.05M....

    Evolving Systems (NASDAQ:EVOL): Q4 EPS of $0.12 in-line. Revenue of $6.9M beats by $0.05M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • CDMO

    More on Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM): Q3 beats on all counts as total revenue nearly...

    More on Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM): Q3 beats on all counts as total revenue nearly doubles. The company cites greater contract manufacturing revenue generated by Avid Bioservices, it's wholly-owned contract manufacturing subsidiary, which generated contract manufacturing revenue of $6.9M for the third quarter of FY 2013, compared to $3.2M for the prior year. For the remainder of FY13, it expects contract manufacturing revenue to be at least $20M. Shares +7.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • MLNX

    A bullish note from Lazard led Mellanox (MLNX +13.8%) to gradually surge to new 2013 highs;...

    A bullish note from Lazard led Mellanox (MLNX +13.8%) to gradually surge to new 2013 highs; shares have now fully recouped the losses they saw following Mellanox's Q4 warning. Following a meeting with management, Lazard thinks business is back on track. The firm has lifted estimates while maintaining a PT of $69.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRDS

    Crossroads Systems (NASDAQ:CRDS): FQ1 EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $3.6M in-line....

    Crossroads Systems (NASDAQ:CRDS): FQ1 EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $3.6M in-line. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • DXCM

    DexCom (DXCM +9%) is set to go out near its highs today after director Jay Skyler disclosed he...

    DexCom (DXCM +9%) is set to go out near its highs today after director Jay Skyler disclosed he had paid $1.1M to buy 70K shares in the company at $15.50 each. After the transaction, Mr. Skyler now holds 274,036 shares, an increase of 34.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • ADVS

    Advent Software (ADVS +11.4%) has hired famous tech i-banker Frank Quattrone to help find a...

    Advent Software (ADVS +11.4%) has hired famous tech i-banker Frank Quattrone to help find a buyer, Reuters reports. Some P-E firms have reportedly shown interest, and the bidding process is now in the second round. However, sources caution there's a "substantial price gap" between Advent and some of the interested parties. Shares have jumped to fresh 52-week highs.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • RWT

    The curious selloff following Redwood Trust's (NYSE:RWT) blowout Q4 earnings on Feb.22 looks...

    The curious selloff following Redwood Trust's (NYSE:RWT) blowout Q4 earnings on Feb.22 looks curiouser with each passing day. The stock's up 3.9% today and 16% since earnings. Deutsche bumped its price target amidst the selloff and Jefferies lifted its last week. Today the company announced presale results on its 4th private MBS, a $576M package.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • HTWR

    HeartWare International (HTWR -2%) trades lower today after the maker of surgically implanted...

    HeartWare International (HTWR -2%) trades lower today after the maker of surgically implanted pumps announced plans to sell 1.5M shares. The company plans to use the new funds for working capital and general corporate purposes, including research and development and expanding its manufacturing facilities.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • RBYCF

    Rubicon Minerals (RBY +11%) agrees to negotiate with the Wabauskang First Nation on development...

    Rubicon Minerals (RBY +11%) agrees to negotiate with the Wabauskang First Nation on development of RBY's Phoenix Gold project in Ontario. RBY and the Ontario government agree to postpone their application for judicial review of a production closure plan.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • GEVA

    Synageva BioPharma (GEVA -4.3%) slides after its Q4 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per...

    Synageva BioPharma (GEVA -4.3%) slides after its Q4 beats on revenue but comes up short on a per share basis. Despite the miss, Piper Jaffray lifts its price target from $53 to $57, citing optimism over upcoming Phase 1/2 data on LAL-D. Wedbush also ups its target to $55 as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • PGRX

    Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -32.5%) sinks to new depths after last night's release of...

    Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -32.5%) sinks to new depths after last night's release of the official termination of Apollo Global's (NYSE:APO) $100M financing agreement. As a termination fee, PGRX paid APO $750K, issued two promissory notes for $6.75M, and reimbursed $2.16M in expenses. Shares have slipped 53% since the termination news first came out.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • GWW

    WW Grainger (GWW -2.2%) slips despite reporting solid February sales growth of 6% Y/Y. Investors...

    WW Grainger (GWW -2.2%) slips despite reporting solid February sales growth of 6% Y/Y. Investors and analysts were looking for growth closer to 10%, but the industrial supply distributor's organic sales growth, largely driven from higher prices, was essentially unchanged from January. Additionally, the company reports that early March sales are also tracking slightly behind February.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • WETF

    The yen's devaluation is boosting WisdomTree (NASDAQ:WETF), of all things, thanks to the ETF...

    The yen's devaluation is boosting WisdomTree (NASDAQ:WETF), of all things, thanks to the ETF provider's Japan Hedged Equity Fund (NYSEARCA:DXJ). The once-small fund has beat all other ETFs in asset-gathering this year with $3.17B, and WisdomTree's stock has soared 57%. "There's a lot of ETF industry hope packed into this one small cap stock," writes Brendan Conway.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • NEE

    NextEra Energy (NEE -2%) shares slide after the company's just-released 8-K says adjusted 2013...

    NextEra Energy (NEE -2%) shares slide after the company's just-released 8-K says adjusted 2013 adjusted EPS should come in at $4.70-$5 vs. $4.95 analyst consensus and expects 2014 adjusted EPS of $5.05-$5.45 vs. $5.33 analyst consensus. Says it may issue $1.5B in stock in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment

  • Xenoport (XPRT -9.2%) takes a hit today, more than offsetting yesterday's post session pop...

    Xenoport (XPRT -9.2%) takes a hit today, more than offsetting yesterday's post session pop following the company's Q4 earnings report yesterday. Revenue came in well below expectations as sales were down over 90% Y/Y. Piper Jaffray cut its price target on the shares, citing limited earning visibility going forward, while Credit Suisse lowers estimates on higher expense concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • UNH

    UnitedHealth (UNH +1.3%) makes some cautious comments today at Barclay's Healthcare Conference...

    UnitedHealth (UNH +1.3%) makes some cautious comments today at Barclay's Healthcare Conference regarding its participation in upcoming health-insurance exchanges. The new state-based marketplaces are supposed to open later this year under the health-overhaul law, which could translate into millions of new members worth billions in revenue for health insurers. But companies have generally been hesitant about their planned participation, opting to wait and see how well markets function first. "Our position on exchanges is that our entry will be measured," says UNH CFO David Wichmann.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • PWRD

    A selloff in Shanghai and poor guidance from Perfect World (PWRD -7.9%) lead some Chinese...

    A selloff in Shanghai and poor guidance from Perfect World (PWRD -7.9%) lead some Chinese Internet stocks to underperform. YY -7.1%. BIDU -2%. SINA -2.5%. GAME -2.6%. Citi has downgraded Perfect World to Neutral on sales and margin concerns. On the earnings call, management mentioned sales of PWRD's popular Torchlight 2 game are expected to see a Q1 drop. One title the company has high hopes for (Neverwinter) will launch in Q2, while two others (Saint Seiya and Swordsman Online) are expected around mid-year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • XOOM

    Underwriter coverage day hasn't been too kind to Xoom (XOOM -3.7%): though the online money...

    Underwriter coverage day hasn't been too kind to Xoom (XOOM -3.7%): though the online money transfer service has received 3 bullish ratings to go with a sole neutral one (from Raymond James), shares are nonetheless lower. Needham and Baird both forecast 25%-30% growth in the coming years to go with solid margin expansion, as the company continues to grab share from incumbents Western Union and MoneyGram. Xoom trades at a healthy 9.2x 2012 sales. (IPO day jump)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • DK

    Delek US Holdings (DK -6%) announces a secondary offering of 7.825M common shares by selling...

    Delek US Holdings (DK -6%) announces a secondary offering of 7.825M common shares by selling stockholder Delek Hungary Holding; DK will not receive any proceeds from the offering. Its board authorizes a $75M common stock repurchase program. Trading resumes after a halt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • GES

    Guess (GES -4.1%) trades lower after word leaks out that the retailer's President of North...

    Guess (GES -4.1%) trades lower after word leaks out that the retailer's President of North America resigned or has been fired. Nothing official from the company just yet.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • BOSC

    Midday top 10 gainers: BOSC +23%. EMITF +19%. OCZ +18%. CLIR +17%. XNY +16%. CIS +14%. GLUU...

    Midday top 10 gainers: BOSC +23%. EMITF +19%. OCZ +18%. CLIR +17%. XNY +16%. CIS +14%. GLUU +13%. TLF +12%. ENPH +12%. CAB +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: RVP -15%. FREE -14%. EMAN -13%. LAKE -13%. CBMX -13%. SHOS -12%. OTC:CALI -11%. AVG -11%. SLCA -10%. HIMX -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • STM

    Not too surprisingly, STMicroelectronics (STM -3.5%) and Ericsson (ERIC +1.8%) have failed to...

    Not too surprisingly, STMicroelectronics (STM -3.5%) and Ericsson (ERIC +1.8%) have failed to find a buyer for money and share-losing ST-Ericsson, six sources tell Bloomberg. Samsung and other prospective buyers reportedly failed to make bids after being approached. A wind-down of the JV is being considered among other options. Shares of both owners have spiked lower, but STM (a much smaller company) is getting the worst of it. (CEO change)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • AMED

    Amedisys (AMED -6.5%) slides after beating on its Q4 EPS but coming up short on revenue. The...

    Amedisys (AMED -6.5%) slides after beating on its Q4 EPS but coming up short on revenue. The company also issued a dour outlook for FY13, now expecting an EPS of $0.60 - $0.70 on revenues of $1.425B - $1.45B. The Street view is for an EPS of $0.78 on revenues of $1.516B.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX +3.8%) has now shipped 2B hard drives since its founding, the company boasts. Both...

    Seagate (STX +3.8%) has now shipped 2B hard drives since its founding, the company boasts. Both Seagate and Western Digital (WDC +2.6%) are rallying - investors might deem the timing of the announcement a positive for March quarter shipments. Separately, WDC announces a "strategic investment" in Skyera, a maker of high-performance flash storage systems featuring a proprietary flash controller and OS. In January, Seagate invested $40M in server flash module maker Virident.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • DK

    Delek US Holdings (DK -5.3%) is halted with news pending, with shares down more than 5%...

    Delek US Holdings (DK -5.3%) is halted with news pending, with shares down more than 5% after hitting an all-time high yesterday. Israel's Globes reports parent company Delek Group (OTCPK:DGRLY) is expected to sell up to $250M, or 12%, of DK stock. DKL -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • SANM

    Sanmina (SANM +3.3%) rallies after announcing a $100M stock buyback, good for repurchasing 10%...

    Sanmina (SANM +3.3%) rallies after announcing a $100M stock buyback, good for repurchasing 10% of outstanding shares at current levels. The contract manufacturer had $491M in cash on its balance sheet as of Dec. 28, but also $898M in debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • LMIA

    LMI Aerospace (LMIA -3%) slips after missing Q4 estimates this morning, coming up just shy on...

    LMI Aerospace (LMIA -3%) slips after missing Q4 estimates this morning, coming up just shy on both counts. Despite the miss, the company saw a 10% jump in total sales on strength in its Aerostructures products and Engineering Services segments. For FY13 the company guides in-line with the Street, but warns that sequestration uncertainty and customer negotiations with its union in its largest Engineering Services market suggest that revenue in that unit for the first half will be substantially below previously anticipated levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • FSLR

    An upgrade to Hold from DNB Markets helps First Solar (FSLR +1.5%) trek higher. "We had been...

    An upgrade to Hold from DNB Markets helps First Solar (FSLR +1.5%) trek higher. "We had been negative on First Solar, believing consensus had looked too high. This has now come down to fall closer in line with our forecasts." The firm is maintaining a PT of $27.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • ECTE

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE +6.7%) says it's been granted a patent for its Prelude SkinPrep...

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE +6.7%) says it's been granted a patent for its Prelude SkinPrep System, a device and method for preparing the skin to allow for analyte extraction or drug delivery. The system is a component of the company's Symphony GSM System, a non-invasive glucose monitoring system.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • AMZN

    While eBay slumps in the wake of ChannelAdvisor's Feb. data, Amazon (AMZN +1.5%) is doing the...

    While eBay slumps in the wake of ChannelAdvisor's Feb. data, Amazon (AMZN +1.5%) is doing the opposite. Same-store sales for ChannelAdvisor clients using Amazon rose 30.8% Y/Y in February, or 34.8% when normalized for the 2012 leap year. That compares with 34.3% growth in January, and indicates Amazon's 3rd-party sales (39% of Q4 paid units) remain healthy.  Google (GOOG -1.1%) saw mixed results: Google Shopping's same-store growth fell to a normalized 4.5% from January's 7.9%, but search e-commerce growth rose to a normalized 4.9% from a prior -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +1.9%) puts a damper on the mini-rally in its own shares by telling Bloomberg...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +1.9%) puts a damper on the mini-rally in its own shares by telling Bloomberg that CEO Ron Johnson has "no plans" to leave the company. Cynics like John Carney wonder if the board just floated a trial balloon to see what shares would be without RJ at the rudder?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 4 Comments
  • PAY

    Susquehanna upgrades VeriFone (PAY +7.5%) to Positive following news long-time CEO Douglas...

    Susquehanna upgrades VeriFone (PAY +7.5%) to Positive following news long-time CEO Douglas Berenson is out. The firm thinks VeriFone might now be an M&A target, and also foresees an upgrade cycle for EMV payment systems. Wedbush also likes the move, but is more cautious. "We believe the new CEO and new CFO Marc Rothman will need to repair the damage their predecessors have left behind, which could lead to further negative developments ... over the next few months/quarters."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 2 Comments
  • JCP

    Is something brewing at J.C. Penney? Chatter has picked up that a CEO resignation could be...

    Is something brewing at J.C. Penney? Chatter has picked up that a CEO resignation could be upcoming for the retailer. Also in the mix, tomorrow the company's CFO is scheduled to give a talk at the Bank of America Merrill Lynch 2013 Consumer and Retail Conference. Traders are betting something is in the wind, JCP +3.1% lickety-split.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 5 Comments

  • Endeavour Silver (EZK +10.9%) surges after Q4 earnings beat estimates and 2013 production...

    Endeavour Silver (EZK +10.9%) surges after Q4 earnings beat estimates and 2013 production guidance is reaffirmed. Silver production is forecast to increase 12%-18% to 5M-5.3M oz., gold production to rise 19%-27% to 46K-49K oz., and silver equivalent production to climb 14%-22% to 7.3M-7.8M oz. at a silver:gold ratio of 50:1.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • ISIL

    The Street gives a thumbs-up to new Intersil (ISIL +5.9%) CEO Necip Sayiner. B. Riley has...

    The Street gives a thumbs-up to new Intersil (ISIL +5.9%) CEO Necip Sayiner. B. Riley has upgraded shares to Buy, and Stifel argues the former Silicon Labs chief has a solid track record in the analog/mixed-signal chip space. Sayiner takes over a company that has seen several quarters of analog share losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY -0.9%) turns lower after the latest batch of data from ChannelAdvisor show the...

    eBay (EBAY -0.9%) turns lower after the latest batch of data from ChannelAdvisor show the company saw its same store sales growth rate fall to its lowest level since April 2011 in February at 8.2%. The reaction could be a tad overdone with the extra leap day last year providing a -3.6% headwind on the comparable for this year. eBay SSS breakdown: eBay auctions -20.3% Y/Y; eBay fixed-price +15.6%; eBay Motors +6.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • RHT

    A downgrade to Neutral from Citi sends Red Hat (RHT -4.7%) lower: the firm cites slowing growth...

    A downgrade to Neutral from Citi sends Red Hat (RHT -4.7%) lower: the firm cites slowing growth and a lack of catalysts. Red Hat is expected by the Street to post 16% growth in FY14 (ends Feb. '14) on top of 17% growth in FY13. FQ4 results arrive on March 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • CBMX

    CombiMatrix (CBMX -7.2%) receives a notice from Nasdaq saying that because it has stockholder's...

    CombiMatrix (CBMX -7.2%) receives a notice from Nasdaq saying that because it has stockholder's equity of -$1.12M, it is no longer in compliance with the exchange's requirement for stockholder equity of +$2.5M. CombiMatrix has until April 25 to present a plan to return to compliance, at which point Nasdaq can grant the company a grace period to carry out the plan or reject it and recommend that CombiMatrix be delisted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
  • ATEC

    Alphatec (NASDAQ:ATEC) +20% premarket after receiving FDA clearance to market and sell its...

    Alphatec (NASDAQ:ATEC) +20% premarket after receiving FDA clearance to market and sell its Alphatec Solus internal fixation anterior lumbar interbody fusion device. ATEC estimates the market for the device at ~$129M in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are lower after seven consecutive days of gains for the Dow and...

    Market preview: Stock futures are lower after seven consecutive days of gains for the Dow and the S&P that have seen the former hit several new highs and left the latter within 10 points of its record close. The run has prompted some to question whether the market is suffering a bout of "irrational exuberance," says Credit Suisse's Oliver Adler, although "most investors seem to be watching markets in disbelief rather than joining in the 'frenzy.'" S&P mini -0.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • GLUU

    Premarket gainers: GLUU +23%. OCZ +15%. LLEN +12%. HEK +9%. PAY +7%. RFIL +7%. YUM +6%.Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: GLUU +23%. OCZ +15%. LLEN +12%. HEK +9%. PAY +7%. RFIL +7%. YUM +6%.
    Losers: PWRD -10%. CBMX -7%. FCEL -7%. RSH -7%. DMND -6%. YNDX -6%. OTC:CALI -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • YPF

    YPF's ambitious program this year calls for drilling 132 oil wells at the Vaca Muerta shale...

    YPF's ambitious program this year calls for drilling 132 oil wells at the Vaca Muerta shale formation in Patagonia, but the high cost of equipment could force it to scale back, CEO Michael Gallucio says after reporting Q4 results. Vaca Muerta holds one of the world's biggest deposits of shale resources, with ~23B boe; YPF has concessions on 40% of the site. YPF +1.7% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) +2.3% - but down from earlier highs - following a report that...

    Life Technologies (NASDAQ:LIFE) +2.3% - but down from earlier highs - following a report that it's again attracting interest from a number of suitors. Shares fell last month when it appeared that the chances of a sale were diminishing.
